forecast.name: Today
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely. Partly sunny. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 54 in the afternoon. Southwest wind 6 to 9 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph. Chance of precipitation is 70%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 48. South southwest wind around 7 mph. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco, a subtle palette of gray blankets the sky, echoing the gentle melancholy of a city caught between rain and its fleeting moments of sun. As we embrace the day, there is a pregnant stillness, a promise of rain hovering in the air, likely to arrive soon as temperatures hover around the mid-fifties. The soft whispers of the southwest wind carry light gusts, barely ruffling the leaves of the streets below. A misting haze may blur the outlines of the Golden Gate, but it also invites you to savor the enchanting allure of the city’s fog—an elegant veil that draws a curtain over the usual clarity of the bay.

On this cool morning, it may be wise to layer up, donning a light waterproof jacket over a cozy sweater while choosing sturdy shoes to navigate puddles and the occasional slippery sidewalk. As the rain taps gently atop glass and sidewalk, perhaps a quiet moment in a nearby café would be the perfect way to celebrate the day—sipping a warming cup of tea or a rich cocoa while watching the world drift by, embracing the gentle rhythm of a November rain in a city imbued with a charm all its own.
